Ratios are a comparison of two things. Always pay attention to the question and ask yourself what is being compared. Whatever comes first is your numerator and 2nd is your denominator. Understanding equivalent fractions will help you understand equivalent ratios as well. In ratios you can be asked to compared one thing to another or one thing to a total, that's why it's important to pay attention to what is being compared. You're welcome!

so essentially how to solve a ratio word problem is
1. identify your ratio and your total
2. add ratio to get your group
3. divide total by group to see how many groups in the total
4. multiply group by what ur trying to find
5. thats ur answer

I couldn't learn this when I was in middle and high school. I went onto college and found out I was capable of learning this stuff, just not in a standard classroom setting. So please don't feel stupid if you're having difficulty learning this especially if its your first time. No one is above math.

So horses to dogs is 2? 10/5 = 2, the ratio of dogs to horses is 0.5. Or the ratio of a 16th of an inch is 1/16 = 0.0625, or 1/16. So how do I convert 0.0625 back?
